You're welcome!

I'm part of the team here at the Internet Archive that originally 
started and now stewards the Heritrix project, which also receives 
contributed code and resources from other developers and institutions. 
Most current Heritrix work at the Internet Archive is being sponsored by 
a group of national libraries.

> One last thing, I need to make a java class that given a certain url
> could search in the crawl results (the arc files) and get all the text
> from that url (no tags) and the from urls linked to that original URL.
> I've checked out ARCREADER but didn't see how this would help me.
> Can you point me in the righr direction with some recomendations about
> any of these requisistes I must comply?

The usual way to do this is to do one pass over the ARCs to create an 
index of what URLs are stored at what file offsets, then use that index 
to randomly access the captures. A usuful start to such an index is the 
'CDX' output format of the ARCReader; see the ARCReader source and 
command-line options for details.

Alls URLs that link to another URL are not retained by the crawler. The 
immediate predecessor URL by which an URL was discovered -- the 'via' -- 
is saved in the crawl.log, but subsequent in-links are simply discarded 
as repeats. Applications that need to rebuild the link graph (like 
link-sensitive indexing/ranking) typically reparse the content.

- Gordon @ IA
